div.p: ONLINE USER 1: Well biology determines how much risk you have...
ONLINE USER 2: Right, so if you have biological risk factors like heredity and high tolerance, than you have a higher risk.
ONLINE USER 3: Biology sets the trigger level...
ONLINE USER 4: Yes, but biology alone doesn't determine whether I'll develop alcoholism... right?
ANTONIO: Right! Our biology establishes our level of risk, but it doesn't control whether or not we develop alcoholism or drug addiction. Choices are the other key piece of the formula.
ANTONIO: The principles we established for the development of heart disease are the same for the development of alcoholism and addiction.

ANTONIO: Biology sets our trigger level. Some people have a standard trigger level. Other people have a lower trigger level, because they have increased biological risk. But, our level of biological risk isn't the only factor.
